text:
Hopefully, you’re able to work with people that you trust and that have empathy.

But either way, my rule of thumb with my team is to be honest. The details are yours to disclose or not disclose, but it’s okay to be as vague as “hey, some days can be really tough on my mental health. the best way for me to cope and get back to regular productivity is X, which means Y. I’m working to minimize impact and frequency. Do you see any issues with this?”

Some folks want to be able to step away from their computer, some want to turn off Zoom. Some need an extra no meeting day. Some take a mental health day. The only impact is sometimes a deadline has to move or you ask your manager or a teammate for help. That’s okay, that’s why we don’t work alone on islands.

text: Everything Arielle said! Speaking from the boss side of things, my husband thinks he has an employee who is struggling with some mental health issues, but the employee hasn't asked for accommodation and hubby/boss wants to respect his space. But he'd be grateful for a no-details-except-what-I-need request like that.
